comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: Built from the remains of British Army Dirigible No. 1 (Nulli Secundus), this is British Army Dirigible No. 2, better known as Nulli Secundus II.   Nulli Secundus II flew three times in July and August 1908, before being scrapped later that month.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
TVL1970:

Very interesting information! Thanks for the heads up on the specific dirigible shown here.  It's helpful that the British Army Dirigible No. 1 is similar, but not identical to this one. We will add to the caption with the more complete identification.

comment.author: 55961052@N00
comment._content: "Nulli Secundus II" seems like an oxymoronic name... meaning "Second to None #2" in Latin
